attributes.action: Encourage homeworking for employees after COVID-19 to help save the planet.
attributes.additional_details:
Seemingly homeworking is working quite well, so encouraging homeworking after the virus is under control will help save the planet and give employees more choice. 
It'll mean: 
Pollution will be reduced as there will be less cars on the road enabling wildlife to recover.
People will be less stressed because they won't have to travel to work in congestion.
People will have a better work/life balance.
attributes.background:
Encourage employers to allow employees to continue to work from home after COV-19 is under control.
If employees don't need to go into the office, letting them stay home if they want will continue to be beneficial.
I believe the old idea that homeworking is detrimental is wrong. It works!

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Study impact of home working on health & the environment and act on the results: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317466

Require suitable businesses offer remote & flexible working to employees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
